item.title: Oblivion Remastered: Attribute Tier List
item.description:
Oblivion Remastered has a flexible character creation and progression system, allowing players to create the most overpowered and broken builds. But if you are a beginner, then at first it may be difficult for you to choose attributes to invest points in. Therefore, in this Tier List, we have ranked all Oblivion Remastered attributes.

Even though the Hero of Kvatch has only 8 attributes, each of them affects you differently. Therefore, if you distribute points incorrectly, you can easily ruin your build.

Oblivion Remastered Attribute Ranking Explained

Attributes in Oblivion Remastered are the foundation of your build. For example, as a Warrior, it is vital for you to have a high Strength attribute. At the same time, it may seem that for a Mage class, this attribute is useless. But in fact, this is not so, since in addition to damage, Strength also affects the weight limit that you can carry. Therefore, when ranking Oblivion Remastered attributes, we relied on their usefulness for builds:

  • S Tie r: These are the most useful Attributes in Oblivion Remastered . No matter what build you use, you should invest points in them to survive, especially in the late game.
  • A Tier : In this Tier, you will find attributes that are useful for most classes and builds.
  • B Tier : B Tier contains attributes that are worth paying attention to only if you use certain classes in Oblivion Remastered .
  • C Tier : Attributes in the C Tier have the least impact on gameplay, so you should level them up last.

Oblivion Remastered Attribute Tier List

Attribute

Tier

Description

Strength

S Tier

This attribute increases damage with most weapons and slightly increases your Health, but most importantly, increases your maximum carrying capacity.

Willpower

S Tier

Increases your Magicka regeneration rate, and also significantly increases your Fatigue.

Endurance

S Tier

Increases your maximum Health and its regeneration rate.

Speed

A Tier

Increases movement speed, including sprinting and fast travel.

Agility

A Tier

Increases damage with certain weapons, such as daggers. Also increases your Fatigue regeneration rate and maximum Fatigue, although less than Willpower.

Intelligence

B Tier

Only affects your maximum Magicka.

Personality

C Tier

Affects the disposition of NPCs to you, as well as the haggling price.

Luck

C Tier

Gives a small hidden bonus to all your stats, but you must have over 50 Luck for this to work. Also slightly reduces the chance of hammers and picks breaking.

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered
49
8.3 /10

item.title: Crusader Kings 3: How To Get The Best Heirs
item.description:
When a ruler dies in Crusader Kings 3 , players will typically continue as their heir, as long as they have one. To continue conquering, residing over peace, or stockpiling vast piles of gold, players will therefore want to have the best heirs, and while luck certainly plays its part, there are plenty of ways to get better heirs in CK3 ​​​​.

How To Give Your Heir The Best Genetics In CK3

Part of getting the best heirs in Crusader Kings 3 is setting them up for life with the best genetics, which results in the best Congenital Traits, such as Beautiful, Genius, and Herculean. These provide stat bonuses , increase opinions, and in the case of the Genius or lesser intelligence Traits, increase Monthly Lifestyle Experience gains .

As Congenital Traits can be inherited , the best advice is to marry a spouse with some of these Traits . The Blood branch of Dynasty Legacies is also great for this, with certain Legacies increasing the chances of inheriting good Traits , and eventually players will be able to choose one Trait to become more common.

Some players use eugenics by switching to Faiths that allow marriage between family members. After a few generations, Congenital Traits will stay in the family.

How To Give Your Heir The Best Education & Personality Traits In CK3

As children grow up in Crusader Kings 3 , they will gain Personality Traits and sometimes additional stats or other bonuses. Upon turning 16, they will gain an Education Trait based on the quality of their education and other factors. Education Traits grant bonuses to Monthly Lifestyle Experience gains in one Lifestyle, such as Stewardship or Intrigue. This makes them incredibly important, as characters with high-tier Education Traits will unlock new Perks much faster.

To improve the education of children and heirs in CK3 , there are a few things players can do.

  • You can change a child's Education Focus once to have them become better at a certain Lifestyle you wish to play as.
  • Consider being your heir's Guardian once they turn 6. This will allow you to shape their Personality Traits via random events, often at the cost of Stress, though.
  • Assign Guardians who are masters in the fields of your heir's Education Focus.
  • Assign Guardians with the Scholar Trait.
  • Hire a skilled Court Tutor and utilize their tasks.
  • Hire a skilled Wet Nurse and use the Instill Virtue tasks for children to possibly gain Virtuous Traits.
  • Send your child to University at the cost of lots of gold.
  • Make sure heirs accompany you on Activities to possibly give them Traits such as Traveler or Pilgrim.
  • Some Cultural Traditions increase the chances of gaining certain Personality Traits.

Ways To Change The Succession To Get Different Heirs In CK3

If players aren't happy with their current heir, there are thankfully a few ways to change the succession and have a different child inherit .

  • Murder: Characters can only murder their own children if they have the Sadistic Trait.
  • Have them die in war: An alternative to outright murder is to assign an heir as commander of an army and send them into an unfair fight.
  • Disinherit: By clicking on an heir while playing as the head of a dynasty, players can disinherit relatives from the succession. However, this costs lots of Prestige, Renown, and Legitimacy.
  • Absolute Crown Authority: This max-level law allows rulers to designate their heir.
  • Change the succession rules: Different succession rules allow for characters other than your eldest child to inherit, such as House Seniority or Elective rules.
  • Choose a new destiny: Upon death, players are now able to select other relatives to play as, but without inheriting the main title. Click on children to make them your favorite so that they are always one of the playable options.
8 Images
8 Images

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: Most Beautiful Locations, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion's new remastered version looks just as stunning as the original did back in 2006.
  • Using Unreal Engine 5, the remaster has new features, like DLSS and real-time lighting, which make the game look gorgeous in many areas.
  • From Frostcrag Spire in the mountains, to Anvil on the coast, the remaster brings new life to locations all across Cyrodiil.

The surprise release of The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered was a delightful treat for both newcomers and longtime fans of the critically-acclaimed series. Unsurprisingly, the remaster quickly found itself high up in Steam's most played games list during its launch week, with over 200,000+ players on PC alone.

Just as the original did in 2006, the new remaster boasts some stunning visuals thanks to its use of Unreal Engine 5, breathing new life into the game. Not to mention making many of Cyrodiil’s most iconic and memorable locations look absolutely beautiful.

8 Imperial Prison Sewers

First Impressions Just As Great As They Were Back In 2006

For a game with so many unique locations, the initial starting area may seem like an odd choice, not to mention it being a prison and all. Situated below the sprawling Imperial City, the Imperial Prison Sewers may not sound like a particularly “stunning” location, but the way it showcases the remasters' new graphical features makes a great introduction.

With its dark corridors, dotted with torches and only a few slivers of daylight coming through the various grates above, it's hard to deny that it’s a great display of the game’s visuals. Making a big first impression on players in the new remaster, just as it did back in 2006.

7 Chorrol

The Colovian City

Situated in Cyrodiil’s Great Forest region to the north-west, Chorrol is a Colovian city, located just near the border with the neighboring province of Hammerfell. Just outside its gates, its surrounding area also includes Weynon Priory, an important location earlier on in the game’s main quest line.

Containing its own variety of shops, services and guilds, the latter of which surround the city’s most defining feature, The Great Oak. Coupled with the city’s unique architectural style, it's a fantastic display of the remaster’s use of Unreal Engine 5, especially when the large oak casts its shadow over the plaza on a sunny day.

6 Imperial City Waterfront

The Capital's Sprawling Port

The Imperial City is Cyrodiil’s capital location, which is divided into multiple different areas, from the bustling Market District, to its peaceful Arboretum. But the city’s Waterfront has to be one of its best-looking sections.

Situated in the southwestern part of the city, the waterfront is filled with a variety of ships and travelers, as well as a gorgeous view over Lake Rumare, which surrounds the large, island-bound city. Not to mention being the location of a certain “shady” guild’s initial quest.

5 Frostcrag Spire

A Mage’s Dream Home

Frostcrag Spire sits in the mountains just east of Bruma, and serves as one of Oblivion’s player homes. The tall, looming tower is certainly geared toward magic-oriented player builds,

The spire is divided into three main parts, with portals for all of Cyrodiil’s Mages Guild locations, and even a fully-stocked alchemy garden, with many other upgrade options for purchase. Featuring anything a Mage could want, Frostcrag Spire looks just as stunning in the remaster with its cold, icy theme and dim blue lighting, also providing a great view across the province from its top area, showcasing the remastered map in its full glory.

4 Castle Skingrad

Located Within Cyrodiil’s Wine Region

Within the forest of West Weald that borders the southern provinces of Valenwood and Elsweyr lies Skingrad, an upper-class city known for its vineyards and wines. West Weald itself is already a gorgeous place to explore, with Skingrad being the main city it houses.

Filled with the usual services and guilds, with perhaps its best-looking area being the uniquely designed fortress of Castle Skingrad. Divided from the rest of the city by a grand bridge, even the walk-up to the castle itself gives a great view of the valley below, leading into its courtyard and interior sections that share the same high-class design as the rest of the city. Nearby, just southeast of the city, lies The Priory of the Nine, one of the primary locations in Oblivion’s Knights of the Nine DLC , as well as a powerful set of armor.

3 Mania

A Brighter Side Of The Shivering Isles

The Realm of Madness, better known as The Shivering Isles, is a plane of Oblivion controlled by the evil Daedric Prince, Sheogorath. The realm is divided into two main regions, the darker side of Dementia in the south, and the brighter side of Mania to the north.

The latter of which is just as fantastic to look at as it is unique. Its strange atmosphere, filled with lush, overgrown plant life and fungi, is a bit eerie in some ways, while also being downright interesting to explore, with its towering mushrooms almost reminiscent of the environment seen in the province of Morrowind .

However, don’t be fooled by the intriguing colors and environment. This is still a plane of Oblivion after all.

2 Anvil

A Beautiful Port-City Along The Gold Coast

Just along the beautiful Gold Coast in the southwest of Cyrodiil lies the city of Anvil. Sitting just on the Abecean Sea, the port city is widely-known across the province for its flourishing harbor.

Anvil is rather small in comparison to Oblivion’s other townships, but still offers all the same guild halls and various services in its main district, but the standout part of the city is its harbor. Filled with a variety of different ships and traveling merchants, with a stunning view of the vast Abecean Sea and the city’s lighthouse in the background to top it all off.

Despite being a bustling area, the Anvil Docks are a rather peaceful area to walk about, or maybe watch Astia’s painting of the Anvil Lighthouse, a nice detail that is still present in the remaster.

1 Gaiar Alata

"Paradise"

The location of Gaiar Alata, commonly referred to as "Paradise", may seem quite fitting at first glance with its beautiful bright weather, flourishing plants, and colorful flowers all over. The irony in its name comes when players realize that, much like the Shivering Isles, "Paradise" is yet another plane of Oblivion.

This time, created by Mankar Camoran, leader of a Daedra-worshipping cult known as the Mythic Dawn, who the player will find themselves face-to-face with many times throughout the main questline. Despite the location's dark background, it was easily one of the most beautiful locations featured in Oblivion back in 2006, and this new remastered version stuns all the same with its visuals.

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered
49
8.3 /10

item.title: Best Hugo W-Engines In Zenless Zone Zero
item.description:
Hugo is a strong DPS in Zenless Zone Zero . As an Attacker, it makes sense how strong Hugo can be during combat, especially since he mainly depends on triggering Crit hits to deal massive DMG.

For Hugo to deliver this amount of DPS, players need to build him with a W-Engine that can enhance his abilities. He can deal a lot of DMG from his EX Special Attacks, Chain Attacks, and Ultimates. For that, this is a list of Hugo’s best W-Engines in Zenless Zone Zero .

6 Gilded Blossom

Base Stat

594 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

25% ATK

W5 Effect

ATK increases by 9.6%, and DMG dealt by EX Special Attacks increases by 24%.

Players can build Hugo with an F2P option like Gilded Blossom . It’s a decent W-Engine that gives Hugo the necessary stats to deal acceptable DMG during combat. The star of the show here is Gilded Blossom’s effect, which increases Hugo’s EX Special Attack DMG, which can be a huge buff.

However, it still doesn’t make Gilded Blossom comparable to any of the other weapons on Hugo’s best W-Engines list in Zenless Zone Zero .

5 Marcato Desire

Base Stat

594 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

20% Crit Rate

W5 Effect

When an EX Special Attack or Chain Attack hits an enemy, the equipper's ATK increases by 9.6% for 8s. While the target is under an Attribute Anomaly, this effect is increased by an additional 9.6%.

For players who have Marcato Desire , Hugo can benefit from its Advanced Stat in Zenless Zone Zero . Marcato Desire can give Hugo an additional ATK% buff, but only this half is easily accessible, while the other needs an Attribute Anomaly on the target, which is not something Hugo’s team will be able to do regularly.

4 Cannon Rotor

Base Stat

594 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

20% Crit Rate

W5 Effect

Increases ATK by 12%. Landing a critical hit on an enemy will inflict an additional 200% of ATK as DMG. This effect can trigger once every 6s.

Another A-Rank W-Engines in Zenless Zone Zero that's great for Hugo is Cannon Rotor . He will get 20% Crit Rate from the weapon’s Advanced Stat, on top of slightly increasing his ATK% while granting him an extra DMG when he lands a Crit.

Of course, it’s not as ideal as an S-Rank W-Engine, especially since Cannon Rotor is a Battle Pass W-Engine, but it’s still worth giving to Hugo if players didn’t have a better option.

3 Heartstring Nocturne

Base Stat

713 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

24% Crit Rate

Effect

CRIT DMG increases by 50%. When the equipper enters the battlefield, or activates a Chain Attack or Ultimate, they gain 1 stack of Heartstring. Each stack of Heartstring allows the equipper's Chain Attack and Ultimate to ignore 12.5% of the target's Fire RES, stacking up to 2 times and lasting 30s. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

Heartstring Nocturne mostly works as a stat stick W-Engine for Hugo in Zenless Zone Zero . Other than the huge amount of Crit value Hugo gets from this weapon, there’s nothing else here, since the rest of the effect help a Fire Attacker in Zenless Zone Zero .

Players can also build Hugo with Severed Innocence or Riot Suppressor Mark VI . Both W-Engines are solid stat sticks that give Hugo a lot of Crit value, just like Heartstring Nocturne.

2 Deep Sea Visitor

Base Stat

713 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

24% Crit Rate

Effect

Increases Ice DMG by 25%. Upon hitting an enemy with a Basic Attack, the equipper's CRIT Rate increases by 10% for 8s. When dealing Ice DMG with a Dash Attack, the equipper's CRIT Rate increases by an additional 10% for 15s. The duration of each effect is calculated separately.

Hugo can borrow another Ice Attacker’s W-Engine, which is Deep Sea Visitor . It grants Hugo extra Ice DMG with a lot of Crit Rate to make it easy for players to build his Drive Disc with maximum Crit DMG.

1 Myriad Eclipse

Base Stat

713 Base ATK

Advanced Stat

24% Crit Rate

Effect

Increases CRIT DMG by 45%. When using an EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate to deal Ice DMG, the equipper gains the Absolute Zero Death Sentence effect for 3s. While Absolute Zero Death Sentence is active, the character ignores 25% of the enemy's DEF when landing a hit.

Undoubtedly, Myriad Eclipse is Hugo’s best W-Engines in Zenless Zone Zero . His Signature W-Engine gives him every stat and effect he needs to perform at the highest level. Starting from the Crit value, Hugo gets a lot of Crit Rate and DMG from Myriad Eclipse without meeting any requirements. Now, when Hugo uses his EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, he will be able to ignore 25% of the enemy’s DEF, which is huge considering these skills are Hugo’s go-to abilities when dealing DMG.

item.title: Hugo Team Composition Guide In Zenless Zone Zero
item.description:
Hugo is a great DPS in Zenless Zone Zero , even if his teams are limited. He suffers when it comes to building his teams because of his Core passive and Additional Ability that gives him a large DPS increase under the condition of having one or two Stun characters in the team.

On the other hand, once players meet that requirement, Hugo starts showing why he’s worth the sacrifice and how much DMG he can deal to stunned enemies. For players looking to make the most of Hugo’s kit, here’s a list of the best teams for Hugo in Zenless Zone Zero .

3 Hugo + Trigger + Lighter

To get the most out of Hugo’s Core passive buffs, players can include two Stun characters in his team. However, two Stun characters can’t work together in the same team since both have the same job. Unless that Stun character is Trigger in Zenless Zone Zero . Trigger is an amazing off-field character who deals a lot of Daze and Aftershock DMG. That allows her to be a great help to Lighter in quickly stunning enemies, on top of increasing enemies’ Stun DMG Multiplier, which further amplifies Hugo’s DPS.

On the other hand, when it comes to a solid Stun character to pair with Hugo, Lighter is definitely the best character for the job. Not only does his mere existence in the team greatly buff Hugo’s DMG, but he’s also specialized in buffing and debuffing Ice DMG, which is a great Support in Zenless Zone Zero .

Players who don't have Lighter can pair Pulchra with Trigger.

Team Roles

  • Hugo: Main DPS
  • Trigger: Sub-DPS, Support, Buffer (With signature W-Engine), Stun
  • Lighter: Stun, Support, Buffer, Debuffer

2 Hugo + Lighter + Astra Yao

In this Hugo team, Astra Yao plays as a Support instead of another Stun character. It’s a slight DPS loss for Hugo since he loses the two Stun characters’ buff from his Core passive. However, her Quick Assist gameplay makes up for that, as it allows Hugo and Lighter to synergize better. Players will continuously quick swap them, maximizing their abilities.

Lighter will keep stunning enemies and applying his Ice DMG buffs and debuffs, then Hugo will enter the field and remove their Stun status to deal massive DMG before leaving the field again for Lighter.

Team Roles

  • Hugo: Main DPS
  • Lighter: Stun, Support, Buffer, Debuffer
  • Astra Yao: Support, Buffer, Healer, Quick Assist Enabler

1 Hugo + Lycaon + Soukaku

This is an F2P Hugo team in Zenless Zone Zero . Lycaon and Soukaku can have Hugo as their DPS instead of Ellen, and they’ll give him the same benefits she had when she was the best DPS in Zenless Zone Zero . Other than being a Stun character, Lycaon’s Stun DMG Multiplier is massive and gives Hugo a window to deal some of the highest DMG in the game while also shredding enemies’ resistance to Ice.

On the other hand, Soukaku grants Hugo a decent ATK and Ice DMG buff, alongside quick swapping with her every time she finishes her rotation. It’s not as ideal as having Lighter and Trigger in the team, but still, Lycaon and Soukaku can create a very solid lineup for a Hugo F2P team in Zenless Zone Zero .

Team Roles

  • Hugo: Main DPS
  • Lycaon: Stun, Support, Buffer, Debuffer
  • Soukaku: Support, Buffer
